flawed_nl_solution:
By the first two months, 1/5*200 = <<1/5*200=1000>>1000 mountains had erupted.
The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is 200-1000= <<200-1000=-800>>-800
When 2/5 of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by 2/5*-800 = <<2/5*-800=-320>>-320
The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is -800--320 = <<-800--320=-480>>-480
When 1/2 of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by 1/2*-480 = <<1/2*-480=-240>>-240
At the end of the year, -480--240 = <<-480--240=-240>>-240 mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 1000. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
